intro: Adelmeria paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. Its botanical features include small, elliptical leaves and a preference for well-drained, acidic soils. Adelmeria paradoxa is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, thriving in mild, coastal climates.
